RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6; TISSUE=Brain, and Embryo;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;
RG   The MGC Project Team;
RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
RN   [2]
RP   FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=18156367; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0709737104;
RA   Soupene E., Fyrst H., Kuypers F.A.;
RT   "Mammalian acyl-CoA:lysophosphatidylcholine acyltransferase enzymes.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 105:88-93(2008).
RN   [3]
RP   TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=18458083; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M800364200;
RA   Cao J., Shan D., Revett T., Li D., Wu L., Liu W., Tobin J.F.,
RA   Gimeno R.E.;
RT   "Molecular identification of a novel mammalian brain isoform of acyl-
RT   CoA:lysophospholipid acyltransferase with prominent ethanolamine
RT   lysophospholipid acylating activity, LPEAT2.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 283:19049-19057(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Displays acyl-CoA-dependent lysophospholipid
CC       acyltransferase activity with a subset of lysophospholipids as
CC       substrates; converts lysophosphatidylethanolamine to
CC       phosphatidylethanolamine, 1-alkenyl-lysophatidylethanolamine to 1-
CC       alkenyl-phosphatidylethanolamine, lysophosphatidylglycerol and
CC       alkyl-lysophosphatidylcholine to phosphatidylglycerol and alkyl-
CC       phosphatidylcholine, respectively. In contrast, has no
CC       lysophosphatidylinositol, glycerol-3-phosphate, diacylglycerol or
CC       lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferase activity. Prefers long chain
CC       acyl-CoAs (C16, C18) as acyl donors (By similarity). Converts
CC       lysophosphatidylcholine to phosphatidycholine. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Acyl-CoA + 1-acyl-sn-glycero-3-
CC       phosphoethanolamine = CoA + 1,2-diacyl-sn-glycero-3-
CC       phosphoethanolamine. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Acyl-CoA + 1-alkenylglycerophosphoethanolamine
CC       = CoA + 1-alkenyl-2-acylglycerophosphoethanolamine.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Acyl-CoA + 1-acyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine
CC       = CoA + 1,2-diacyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Acetyl-CoA + 1-alkyl-sn-glycero-3-
CC       phosphocholine = CoA + 2-acetyl-1-alkyl-sn-glycero-3-
CC       phosphocholine. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Acyl-CoA + 1-acyl-sn-glycero-3-
CC       phosphatidylserine = CoA + 1,2-diacyl-sn-glycero-3-
CC       phosphatidylserine. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Lipid metabolism; phospholipid metabolism.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed with much higher level in
CC       brain. Expressed in erythroleukemic cells but not in
CC       reticulocytes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18156367,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18458083}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the 1-acyl-sn-glycerol-3-phosphate
CC       acyltransferase family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-293 AND LYS-547, AND
RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as component of the MCM2-7 complex (MCM complex)
CC       which is the putative replicative helicase essential for 'once per
CC       cell cycle' DNA replication initiation and elongation in
CC       eukaryotic cells. The active ATPase sites in the MCM2-7 ring are
CC       formed through the interaction surfaces of two neighboring
CC       subunits such that a critical structure of a conserved arginine
CC       finger motif is provided in trans relative to the ATP-binding site
CC       of the Walker A box of the adjacent subunit. The six ATPase active
CC       sites, however, are likely to contribute differentially to the
CC       complex helicase activity. Required for DNA replication and cell
CC       proliferation.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O = ADP + phosphate.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the MCM2-7 complex. The complex forms a
CC       toroidal hexameric ring with the proposed subunit order MCM2-MCM6-
CC       MCM4-MCM7-MCM3-MCM5. Associated with the replication-specific DNA
CC       polymerase alpha. Interacts with MCMBP (By simililarity).
CC       Interacts with ANKRD17. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P25205}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus.
CC   -!- PTM: O-glycosylated (O-GlcNAcylated), in a cell cycle-dependent
CC       manner. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MCM family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 MCM domain. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [6]
RP   INTERACTION WITH DNAJB9.
RX   PubMed=22267725; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M111.311290;
RA   Lai C.W., Otero J.H., Hendershot L.M., Snapp E.;
RT   "ERdj4 protein is a soluble endoplasmic reticulum (ER) DnaJ family
RT   protein that interacts with ER-associated degradation machinery.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 287:7969-7978(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functional component of endoplasmic reticulum-associated
CC       degradation (ERAD) for misfolded lumenal proteins. May act by
CC       forming a channel that allows the retrotranslocation of misfolded
CC       proteins into the cytosol where they are ubiquitinated and
CC       degraded by the proteasome. May mediate the interaction between
CC       VCP and the degradation substrate (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homo- and heterooligomers with DERL2 and DERL3;
CC       binding to DERL3 is poorer than that between DERL2 and DERL3.
CC       Interacts with AMFR, VIMP/SELS, SEL1L, SELKM, SYVN1 and VCP, as
CC       well as with SEL1L-SYVN1 and VCP-VIMP protein complexes; this
CC       interaction is weaker than that observed between DERL2 and these
CC       complexes. Interacts with NGLY1 and YOD1. Does not bind to EDEM1
CC       (By similarity). Interacts with RNF103 (By similarity). Interacts
CC       with DNAJB9 (PubMed:22267725). Part of a complex which includes
CC       CANX, DERL1, DERL2, DDOST/OST48, RPN1, RPN2, SELK, VIMP, STT3A AND
CC       VCP. Interacts with HM13. Interacts with XBP1 (via
CC       luminal/ectodomain domain); the interaction obviates the need for
CC       ectodomain shedding prior HM13/SPP-mediated XBP1 cleavage (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9BUN8,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22267725}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed, with lowest levels in brain
CC       and heart. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16186509}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated in response to endoplasmic reticulum
CC       stress via the ERN1-XBP1 pathway of the unfolded protein response
CC       (UPR). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16186509, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16449189}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the derlin family. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [3]
RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH TERF1 AND TERT, AND MUTAGENESIS OF ASN-166.
RX   PubMed=19487455; DOI=10.1083/jcb.200812121;
RA   Zhu Q., Meng L., Hsu J.K., Lin T., Teishima J., Tsai R.Y.;
RT   "GNL3L stabilizes the TRF1 complex and promotes mitotic transition.";
RL   J. Cell Biol. 185:827-839(2009).
RN   [4]
RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH MDM2 AND TP53, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND
RP   MUTAGENESIS OF GLY-253.
RX   PubMed=21132010; DOI=10.1038/onc.2010.550;
RA   Meng L., Hsu J.K., Tsai R.Y.;
RT   "GNL3L depletion destabilizes MDM2 and induces p53-dependent G2/M
RT   arrest.";
RL   Oncogene 30:1716-1726(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Stabilizes TERF1 telomeric association by preventing
CC       TERF1 recruitment by PML. Stabilizes TERF1 protein by preventing
CC       its ubiquitination and hence proteasomal degradation. Does so by
CC       interfering with TERF1-binding to FBXO4 E3 ubiquitin-protein
CC       ligase. Required for cell proliferation. By stabilizing TRF1
CC       protein during mitosis, promotes metaphase-to-anaphase transition.
CC       Stabilizes MDM2 protein by preventing its ubiquitination, and
CC       hence proteasomal degradation. By acting on MDM2, may affect TP53
CC       activity. Required for normal processing of ribosomal pre-rRNA.
CC       Binds GTP (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MDM2; this interaction, which occurs in
CC       the nucleoplasm, stabilizes MDM2. Indirectly interacts with TP53,
CC       via MDM2-binding. Interacts with TERF1; this interaction probably
CC       occurs in the nucleoplasm and is increased during mitosis, when
CC       the nucleolus is disassembled. This binding may promote TERF1
CC       homodimerization. Interacts with TERT.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19487455, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21132010}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleolus
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21132010}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: In contrast to other GTP-binding proteins, this family is
CC       characterized by a circular permutation of the GTPase motifs
CC       described by a G4-G1-G3 pattern.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAFAC class YlqF/YawG GTPase family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01058}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 CP-type G (guanine nucleotide-binding)
CC       domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01058}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-24, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Myristoyl-binding protein that acts as a cargo adapter:
CC       specifically binds the myristoyl moiety of a subset of N-
CC       terminally myristoylated proteins and is required for their
CC       localization. Binds myristoylated NPHP3 and plays a key role in
CC       localization of NPHP3 to the primary cilium membrane. Does not
CC       bind all myristoylated proteins. Probably plays a role in
CC       trafficking proteins in photoreceptor cells (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Found in a complex with ARL3, RP2 and UNC119B; RP2
CC       induces hydrolysis of GTP ARL3 in the complex, leading to the
CC       release of UNC119B. Interacts with NPHP3 (when myristoylated).
CC       Interacts with CYS1 (when myristoylated). Interacts with C5orf30;
CC       interaction only takes place when UNC119B is not liganded with
CC       myristoylated proteins (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell projection, cilium {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Enriched at the transition zone and extended into the
CC       proximal end of the cilium. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8C4B4-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8C4B4-2; Sequence=VSP_033985;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Adopts an immunoglobulin-like beta-sandwich fold forming a
CC       hydrophobic cavity that capture N-terminally myristoylated target
CC       peptides. Phe residues within the hydrophobic beta sandwich are
CC       required for myristate binding (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the PDE6D/unc-119 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in various neuronal structures
CC       during embryonic development, including spinal ganglia, trigeminal
CC       nerve and ganglion, olfactory and nasopharyngeal epithelium,
CC       nuclei of the metencephalon, thalamus and medulla oblongata. Also
CC       expressed in lung, esophagus, epiglottis, ependyma, vertebral
CC       column, spinal cord and brown adipose tissue. Expression persists
CC       in the adult brain with dynamically changing patterns in cortex
CC       and cerebellum. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17198746}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice are viable and show no apparent
CC       anatomical defects. However, they display significantly altered
CC       motor coordination and aberrant exploratory behavior.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17198746}.

CC       methyltransferase superfamily. Trm1 family. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00958}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] OF 38-332.
RC   TISSUE=Embryo;
RA   Schmidt T.;
RL   Thesis (2001), University of Goettingen, Germany.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Microtubule-binding protein essential for faithful
CC       chromosome segregation. Mediates TRF1 and TERT accumulation in
CC       nucleolus and enhances TRF1 binding to telomeres. Inhibits
CC       telomerase activity. May inhibit cell proliferation and act as
CC       tumor suppressor (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MCRS1, TERT, TERF1, NCL/nucleolin, and the
CC       telomerase RNA. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleolus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Chromosome, telomere {ECO:0000250}. Chromosome,
CC       centromere, kinetochore {ECO:0000250}. Note=Localizes in nucleoli,
CC       at telomere speckles and to the outer plate of kinetochores.
CC       Localization to the kinetochore is mediated by its central region
CC       and depends on NDC80 and CENPE (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The TID (telomerase inhibiting domain) domain is
CC       sufficient to bind TERT and inhibits its activity. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The TBM domain mediates interaction with TERF1.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the PINX1 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 G-patch domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00092}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] OF 4-443 (ISOFORM 1), AND IDENTIFICATION IN
RP   THE CSN COMPLEX.
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6;
RX   PubMed=9707402; DOI=10.1016/S0960-9822(07)00372-7;
RA   Wei N., Tsuge T., Serino G., Dohmae N., Takio K., Matsui M.,
RA   Deng X.-W.;
RT   "The COP9 complex is conserved between plants and mammals and is
RT   related to the 26S proteasome regulatory complex.";
RL   Curr. Biol. 8:919-922(1998).
RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH CUL1 AND CUL2.
RX   PubMed=11967155; DOI=10.1016/S0960-9822(02)00791-1;
RA   Yang X., Menon S., Lykke-Andersen K., Tsuge T., Xiao D., Wang X.,
RA   Rodriguez-Suarez R.J., Zhang H., Wei N.;
RT   "The COP9 signalosome inhibits p27(kip1) degradation and impedes G1-S
RT   phase progression via deneddylation of SCF Cul1.";
RL   Curr. Biol. 12:667-672(2002).
RN   [6]
RP   FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH NIF3L1.
RX   PubMed=12522100; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M209856200;
RA   Akiyama H., Fujisawa N., Tashiro Y., Takanabe N., Sugiyama A.,
RA   Tashiro F.;
RT   "The role of transcriptional corepressor Nif3l1 in early stage of
RT   neural differentiation via cooperation with Trip15/CSN2.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 278:10752-10762(2003).
RN   [7]
RP   FUNCTION, AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=12972599; DOI=10.1128/MCB.23.19.6790-6797.2003;
RA   Lykke-Andersen K., Schaefer L., Menon S., Deng X.-W., Miller J.B.,
RA   Wei N.;
RT   "Disruption of the COP9 signalosome Csn2 subunit in mice causes
RT   deficient cell proliferation, accumulation of p53 and cyclin E, and
RT   early embryonic death.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Biol. 23:6790-6797(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential component of the COP9 signalosome complex
CC       (CSN), a complex involved in various cellular and developmental
CC       processes. The CSN complex is an essential regulator of the
CC       ubiquitin (Ubl) conjugation pathway by mediating the deneddylation
CC       of the cullin subunits of SCF-type E3 ligase complexes, leading to
CC       decrease the Ubl ligase activity of SCF-type complexes such as
CC       SCF, CSA or DDB2. The complex is also involved in phosphorylation
CC       of p53/TP53, c-jun/JUN, IkappaBalpha/NFKBIA, ITPK1 and IRF8/ICSBP,
CC       possibly via its association with CK2 and PKD kinases. CSN-
CC       dependent phosphorylation of TP53 and JUN promotes and protects
CC       degradation by the Ubl system, respectively. Involved in early
CC       stage of neuronal differentiation via its interaction with NIF3L1.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11967155, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12522100,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12972599}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the CSN complex, composed of COPS1/GPS1,
CC       COPS2, COPS3, COPS4, COPS5, COP6, COPS7 (COPS7A or COPS7B) and
CC       COPS8. In the complex, it probably interacts directly with COPS1,
CC       COPS4, COPS5 COPS6 and COPS7 (COPS7A or COPS7B). Specifically
CC       interacts with the ligand binding domain of the thyroid receptor
CC       (TR). Does not require the presence of thyroid hormone for its
CC       interaction. Interacts with IRF8/ICSBP1 and with nuclear receptors
CC       NR2F1 and NR0B1 (By similarity). Interacts with NIF3L1. Interacts
CC       with CUL1 and CUL2. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11967155,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12522100, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9707402}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10087198}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10087198}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P61202-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P61202-2; Sequence=VSP_011885;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed in embryonic, fetal and adult
CC       tissues, except cartilage and smooth muscle.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10087198}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by CK2 and PKD kinases. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Its absence causes arrest of embryo
CC       development at the peri-implantation stage. Blastocysts without
CC       Cops2 fail to outgrow in culture and exhibit a cell proliferation
CC       defect in inner cell mass, accompanied by a slight decrease in
CC       Oct4. In addition, lack of Cops2 disrupts the CSN complex and
CC       results in a drastic increase in cyclin E. It also induces
CC       elevated levels of p53 and p21, which may contribute to premature
CC       cell cycle arrest of the mutant. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12972599}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the CSN2 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PCI domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAH23096.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: GTPase tethering membranes through formation of trans-
CC       homooligomers and mediating homotypic fusion of endoplasmic
CC       reticulum membranes. Functions in endoplasmic reticulum tubular
CC       network biogenesis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Localizes to endoplasmic reticulum tubules and accumulates in
CC       punctuate structures corresponding to 3-way junctions, which
CC       represent crossing-points at which the tubules build a polygonal
CC       network. {ECO:0000250}.

RN   [4]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 2-22; 29-57; 61-109; 112-134; 154-258; 260-312 AND
RP   323-364, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6, and OF1; TISSUE=Brain, and Hippocampus;
RA   Lubec G., Kang S.U., Klug S., Yang J.W., Zigmond M., Sunyer B.,
RA   Chen W.-Q.;
RL   Submitted (JAN-2009) to UniProtKB.
RN   [5]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] OF 99-355.
RX   PubMed=3009179; DOI=10.1111/j.1432-1033.1986.tb09572.x;
RA   Paolella G., Buono P., Mancini P., Izzo P., Salvatore F.;
RT   "Structure and expression of mouse aldolase genes. Brain-specific
RT   aldolase C amino acid sequence is closely related to aldolase A.";
RL   Eur. J. Biochem. 156:229-235(1986).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Plays a key role in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis. In
CC       addition, may also function as scaffolding protein (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: D-fructose 1,6-bisphosphate = glycerone
CC       phosphate + D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; D-glyceraldehyde 3-
CC       phosphate and glycerone phosphate from D-glucose: step 4/4.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. Interacts with SNX9 and WAS. Interacts with
CC       FBP2; the interaction blocks FBP2 inhibition by physiological
CC       concentrations of AMP and reduces inhibition by Ca(2+) (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, myofibril, sarcomere, I band.
CC       Cytoplasm, myofibril, sarcomere, M line. Note=In skeletal muscle,
CC       accumulates around the M line and within the I band, colocalizing
CC       with FBP2 on both sides of the Z line in the absence of Ca(2+).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In vertebrates, three forms of this ubiquitous
CC       glycolytic enzyme are found, aldolase A in muscle, aldolase B in
CC       liver and aldolase C in brain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class I fructose-bisphosphate aldolase
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] OF 281-363, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RC   STRAIN=BALB/c; TISSUE=Brain;
RX   PubMed=10719228; DOI=10.1016/S0169-328X(00)00028-0;
RA   Dandoy-Dron F.C., Benboudjema L., Guillo F., Jaegly A., Jasmin C.,

RT   "Enhanced levels of scrapie responsive gene mRNA in BSE-infected mouse

RL   Brain Res. Mol. Brain Res. 76:173-179(2000).
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: D-fructose 1,6-bisphosphate = glycerone
CC       phosphate + D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; D-glyceraldehyde 3-
CC       phosphate and glycerone phosphate from D-glucose: step 4/4.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. Interacts with ATP6V1E1 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed exclusively in Purkinje cells in
CC       bands running from anterior to posterior across most of the
CC       cerebellum. Expressed at higher levels in the brains of BSE-
CC       infected animals. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10719228,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7925012}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression begins in the first week of
CC       postnatal life. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7925012}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In vertebrates, three forms of this ubiquitous
CC       glycolytic enzyme are found, aldolase A in muscle, aldolase B in
CC       liver and aldolase C in brain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class I fructose-bisphosphate aldolase
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Ribosome biogenesis factor. May be required for both
CC       optimal rDNA transcription and small subunit (SSU) pre-rRNA
CC       processing at sites A', A0, 1 and 2b (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.

CC       within this complex, directly interacts with CIRH1A. Interacts
CC       with FBL/fibrillarin in a transcription-dependent manner (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functions in the early steps of protein synthesis of a
CC       small number of specific mRNAs. Acts by directing the binding of
CC       methionyl-tRNAi to 40S ribosomal subunits. In contrast to the eIF-
CC       2 complex, it binds methionyl-tRNAi to 40 S subunits in a codon-
CC       dependent manner, whereas the eIF-2 complex binds methionyl-tRNAi
CC       to 40 S subunits in a GTP-dependent manner. May act by impiging
CC       the expression of specific proteins (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
